value:
My father's life's work was to claim
the fertile northern Thracia. It was
not for him, but the people.

We wyvern knights are formidable,
but we could not face the empire
alone. Careful strategy was needed.

When he entrusted me with the lance
Gungnir, my father told me not to let
the people of Thracia suffer further.

It is a luxury to have a place to rest
one's wings. I am grateful for it.

Battles may be won with strategy and
might, but without a righteous cause,
faith can falter...and then all is lost.

I am no mere messenger. That said,
I come bearing something on behalf
of $Nf.

They call Thracia a country of hyenas
simply for being willing to work with
whomever we must to survive.

This is a battlefield. There will be
no holding back.

Altena continued to call me her
brother, even though she knew
the truth about her birth...
Is this for me? You have my thanks.

I am Arion, son of the king of Thracia,
Travant—and I will be your opponent.
Show me what you are capable of!

My father said that unifying Thracia
was his life's work—that our people
needed the fertile northern land.$k$pI know full well that Altena, Hannibal,
and others despise the empire's way
of doing things.$k$pBut the hard truth is that, without the
empire's help, Thracia would have
ceased to exist. We had no choice.$k$pI had planned to die on the battlefield
as a warrior, in solidarity with my
father...but, as you can see, I yet live.$k$pI have decided that my purpose now
should be to support the new Thracia
from the shadows.$k$pIf you want to live a life free from
regret, you must find a path that you
believe in, $Nu.
Fate has willed this.
I will hold nothing back.
Let this be a lesson.
Triumph or death?
Altena, forgive me...
I am Arion of Thracia, son of King Travant.
*gasp* Put a stop to your rudeness.
I...was wrong. Altena's entreaty opened my eyes.
For me, there is no longer a place to return.
I have never seen the king like this. What has shaken my father so?
Altena, you could not understand Father as deeply as I.
This contract with you may be my last.
Yes.
Your plan?
Press on.
